Events.html: 769 – The Lateran Council condemned the Council of Hieria and anathematized its iconoclastic rulings.
Events.text: The Lateran Council condemned the Council of Hieria and anathematized its iconoclastic rulings.

Events.html: 1071 – Bari, the last Byzantine possession in southern Italy, is surrendered to Robert Guiscard.
Events.text: Bari, the last Byzantine possession in southern Italy, is surrendered to Robert Guiscard.

Events.html: 1395 – Tokhtamysh–Timur war: Battle of the Terek River: Timur defeats Tokhtamysh of the Golden Horde at the Volga. The Golden Horde capital city, Sarai, is razed to the ground and Timur installs a puppet ruler on the Golden Horde throne. Tokhtamysh escapes to Lithuania.
Events.text: Tokhtamysh–Timur war: Battle of the Terek River: Timur defeats Tokhtamysh of the Golden Horde at the Volga. The Golden Horde capital city, Sarai, is razed to the ground and Timur installs a puppet ruler on the Golden Horde throne. Tokhtamysh escapes to Lithuania.

Events.html: 1450 – Battle of Formigny: Toward the end of the Hundred Years' War, the French attack and nearly annihilate English forces, ending English domination in Northern France.
Events.text: Battle of Formigny: Toward the end of the Hundred Years' War, the French attack and nearly annihilate English forces, ending English domination in Northern France.

Events.html: 1632 – Battle of Rain: Swedes under Gustavus Adolphus defeat the Holy Roman Empire during the Thirty Years' War.
Events.text: Battle of Rain: Swedes under Gustavus Adolphus defeat the Holy Roman Empire during the Thirty Years' War.

Events.html: 1638 – Tokugawa shogunate forces put down the Shimabara Rebellion when they retake Hara Castle from the rebels.
Events.text: Tokugawa shogunate forces put down the Shimabara Rebellion when they retake Hara Castle from the rebels.

Events.html: 1642 – Irish Confederate Wars: A Confederate Irish militia is routed in the Battle of Kilrush when it attempts to halt the progress of a Parliamentarian army.
Events.text: Irish Confederate Wars: A Confederate Irish militia is routed in the Battle of Kilrush when it attempts to halt the progress of a Parliamentarian army.

Events.html: 1715 – The Pocotaligo Massacre triggers the start of the Yamasee War in colonial South Carolina.
Events.text: The Pocotaligo Massacre triggers the start of the Yamasee War in colonial South Carolina.

Events.html: 1738 – Serse, an Italian opera by George Frideric Handel receives its premiere performance in London, England.
Events.text: Serse, an Italian opera by George Frideric Handel receives its premiere performance in London, England.

Events.html: 1755 – Samuel Johnson's A Dictionary of the English Language is published in London.
Events.text: Samuel Johnson's A Dictionary of the English Language is published in London.

links.subject: A Dictionary of the English Language
links.title: A Dictionary of the English Language

Events.html: 1783 – Preliminary articles of peace ending the American Revolutionary War (or American War of Independence) are ratified.
Events.text: Preliminary articles of peace ending the American Revolutionary War (or American War of Independence) are ratified.

Events.html: 1802 – William Wordsworth and his sister, Dorothy see a "long belt" of daffodils, inspiring the former to pen I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud.
Events.text: William Wordsworth and his sister, Dorothy see a "long belt" of daffodils, inspiring the former to pen I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud.

links.subject: I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud
links.title: I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud

Events.html: 1817 – Thomas Hopkins Gallaudet and Laurent Clerc founded the American School for the Deaf, the first American school for deaf students, in Hartford, Connecticut.
Events.text: Thomas Hopkins Gallaudet and Laurent Clerc founded the American School for the Deaf, the first American school for deaf students, in Hartford, Connecticut.

Events.html: 1861 – President Abraham Lincoln calls for 75,000 Volunteers to quell the insurrection that soon became the American Civil War
Events.text: President Abraham Lincoln calls for 75,000 Volunteers to quell the insurrection that soon became the American Civil War

Events.html: 1865 – Abraham Lincoln dies after being shot the previous evening by actor John Wilkes Booth.
Events.text: Abraham Lincoln dies after being shot the previous evening by actor John Wilkes Booth.

Events.html:
1892 – The General Electric Company is formed.
RMS Titanic disaster.
Events.text:
The General Electric Company is formed.




RMS Titanic disaster.

Events.html: 1896 – Closing ceremony of the Games of the I Olympiad in Athens, Greece.
Events.text: Closing ceremony of the Games of the I Olympiad in Athens, Greece.

Events.html: 1900 – Philippine–American War: Filipino guerrillas launch a surprise attack on U.S. infantry and begin a four-day siege of Catubig, Philippines.
Events.text: Philippine–American War: Filipino guerrillas launch a surprise attack on U.S. infantry and begin a four-day siege of Catubig, Philippines.

Events.html: 1907 – Triangle Fraternity was founded at the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign
Events.text: Triangle Fraternity was founded at the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign

Events.html: 1912 – The British passenger liner RMS Titanic sinks in the North Atlantic at 2:20 a.m., two hours and forty minutes after hitting an iceberg. Only 710 of 2,227 passengers and crew on board survive.
Events.text: The British passenger liner RMS Titanic sinks in the North Atlantic at 2:20 a.m., two hours and forty minutes after hitting an iceberg. Only 710 of 2,227 passengers and crew on board survive.

Events.html: 1920 – Two security guards are murdered during a robbery in South Braintree, Massachusetts. Anarchists Sacco and Vanzetti would be convicted of and executed for the crime, amid much controversy.
Events.text: Two security guards are murdered during a robbery in South Braintree, Massachusetts. Anarchists Sacco and Vanzetti would be convicted of and executed for the crime, amid much controversy.

Events.html: 1921 – Black Friday: mine owners announce more wage and price cuts, leading to the threat of a strike all across England.
Events.text: Black Friday: mine owners announce more wage and price cuts, leading to the threat of a strike all across England.

Events.html: 1922 – U.S. Senator John B. Kendrick of Wyoming introduces a resolution calling for an investigation of secret land deal, which leads to the discovery of the Teapot Dome scandal.
Events.text: U.S. Senator John B. Kendrick of Wyoming introduces a resolution calling for an investigation of secret land deal, which leads to the discovery of the Teapot Dome scandal.

Events.html: 1923 – Insulin becomes generally available for use by people with diabetes.
Events.text: Insulin becomes generally available for use by people with diabetes.

Events.html: 1924 – Rand McNally publishes its first road atlas.
Events.text: Rand McNally publishes its first road atlas.

Events.html: 1927 – The Great Mississippi Flood of 1927, the most destructive river flood in U.S. history, begins.
Events.text: The Great Mississippi Flood of 1927, the most destructive river flood in U.S. history, begins.

Events.html: 1935 – Roerich Pact signed in Washington, D.C.
Events.text: Roerich Pact signed in Washington, D.C.

Events.html: 1936 – First day of the Arab revolt in Mandatory Palestine.
Events.text: First day of the Arab revolt in Mandatory Palestine.

Events.html: 1936 – Aer Lingus (Aer Loingeas) is founded by the Irish government as the national airline of the Republic of Ireland.
Events.text: Aer Lingus (Aer Loingeas) is founded by the Irish government as the national airline of the Republic of Ireland.

Events.html: 1940 – The Allies begin their attack on the Norwegian town of Narvik which is occupied by Nazi Germany.
Events.text: The Allies begin their attack on the Norwegian town of Narvik which is occupied by Nazi Germany.

Events.html: 1941 – In the Belfast Blitz, two-hundred bombers of the German Luftwaffe attack Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom killing one thousand people.
Events.text: In the Belfast Blitz, two-hundred bombers of the German Luftwaffe attack Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom killing one thousand people.

Events.html: 1942 – The George Cross is awarded "to the island fortress of Malta – its people and defenders" by King George VI.
Events.text: The George Cross is awarded "to the island fortress of Malta – its people and defenders" by King George VI.

links.subject: King George VI
links.title: George VI of the United Kingdom

Events.html: 1945 – The Bergen-Belsen concentration camp is liberated.
Events.text: The Bergen-Belsen concentration camp is liberated.

Events.html: 1947 – Jackie Robinson debuts for the Brooklyn Dodgers, breaking baseball's color line.
Events.text: Jackie Robinson debuts for the Brooklyn Dodgers, breaking baseball's color line.

Events.html: 1952 – The maiden flight of the B-52 Stratofortress
Events.text: The maiden flight of the B-52 Stratofortress

Events.html: 1955 – McDonald's restaurant dates its founding to the opening of a franchised restaurant by Ray Kroc, in Des Plaines, Illinois
Events.text: McDonald's restaurant dates its founding to the opening of a franchised restaurant by Ray Kroc, in Des Plaines, Illinois

Events.html: 1957 – White Rock, British Columbia officially separates from Surrey, British Columbia and is incorporated as a new city.
Events.text: White Rock, British Columbia officially separates from Surrey, British Columbia and is incorporated as a new city.

Events.html: 1960 – At Shaw University in Raleigh, North Carolina, Ella Baker leads a conference that results in the creation of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee, one of the principal organizations of the African-American Civil Rights Movement in the 1960s.
Events.text: At Shaw University in Raleigh, North Carolina, Ella Baker leads a conference that results in the creation of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee, one of the principal organizations of the African-American Civil Rights Movement in the 1960s.

Events.html: 1964 – The first Ford Mustang rolls off the show room floor, two days before it is set to go on sale nationwide.
Events.text: The first Ford Mustang rolls off the show room floor, two days before it is set to go on sale nationwide.

Events.html: 1969 – The EC-121 shootdown incident: North Korea shoots down a United States Navy aircraft over the Sea of Japan, killing all 31 on board.
Events.text: The EC-121 shootdown incident: North Korea shoots down a United States Navy aircraft over the Sea of Japan, killing all 31 on board.

Events.html: 1970 – During the Cambodian Civil War, massacres of the Vietnamese minority results in 800 bodies flowing down the Mekong River into South Vietnam.
Events.text: During the Cambodian Civil War, massacres of the Vietnamese minority results in 800 bodies flowing down the Mekong River into South Vietnam.

Events.html: 1984 – The inaugural World Youth Day is held in St. Peter's Square, Vatican City.
Events.text: The inaugural World Youth Day is held in St. Peter's Square, Vatican City.

Events.html: 1986 – The United States launches Operation El Dorado Canyon, its bombing raids against Libyan targets in response to a bombing in West Germany that killed two U.S. servicemen.
Events.text: The United States launches Operation El Dorado Canyon, its bombing raids against Libyan targets in response to a bombing in West Germany that killed two U.S. servicemen.

links.subject: Libyan targets
links.title: History of Libya under Muammar Gaddafi

Events.html: 1989 – Hillsborough disaster: A human crush occurs at Hillsborough Stadium, home of Sheffield Wednesday, in the FA Cup Semi-final, resulting in the deaths of 96 Liverpool fans.
Events.text: Hillsborough disaster: A human crush occurs at Hillsborough Stadium, home of Sheffield Wednesday, in the FA Cup Semi-final, resulting in the deaths of 96 Liverpool fans.

Events.html: 1989 – Upon Hu Yaobang's death, the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989 begin in China.
Events.text: Upon Hu Yaobang's death, the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989 begin in China.

Events.html: 2013 – Two bombs explode near the finish line at the Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts, killing three people and injuring 264 others.
Events.text: Two bombs explode near the finish line at the Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts, killing three people and injuring 264 others.

Events.html: 2014 – More than 200 female students are declared missing after a mass kidnapping in Borno State, Nigeria.
Events.text: More than 200 female students are declared missing after a mass kidnapping in Borno State, Nigeria.

Events.html: 2014 – A total lunar eclipse occurs, producing a Blood Moon.
Events.text: A total lunar eclipse occurs, producing a Blood Moon.
